solution_line_template: The CD is {cd_discount_percentage} * {album_price} = $<<{cd_discount_percentage}*{album_price}={cd_discount_amount}>>{cd_discount_amount} cheaper than the album.
So the cost of the CD is {album_price} - {cd_discount_amount} = $<<{album_price}-{cd_discount_amount}={cd_cost}>>{cd_cost}.
The book is ${book_extra_cost} more expensive than the CD, which means it cost {cd_cost} + {book_extra_cost} = $<<{cd_cost}+{book_extra_cost}={book_cost}>>{book_cost}.
